Academic Rigor
Tips for prospective students
In three sentences
Comments
There are officers on campus as well as emergency buttons in parking lots.
There are an abundance of clubs and activities offered at Wake tech.
Students who are seeking to better their skills or get a degree will love this college.

The Northern campus has a nice field with pond and the buildings are brand new, it is a very clean and kept campus. Parking is tough to find unless you don't mind walking because they have an additional unpaved parking lot.
I pay out of state tuition and it is a killer! There is a financial aid office on campus though.
Wake tech has many different clubs that welcome new members. They also have a gym!
The cafe has a nice selection of good tasting foods.
No Dorms
The courses vary in rigor depending on the subject, but most teachers are very good about making sure the students are understanding the material.
Wake Tech offers many Associates degree programs or if you want to transfer to a university, Wake Tech is a great school to prepare you for it because they facilitate an Honors Program.
Wake Tech has multiple locations, with new campuses, and great teachers. The staff is professional and direct. Registering for classes can be tough, but the staff will assist you if necessary.
pageTitle: Wake Technical Community College Reviews: Student Reviews and Ratings | Cappex
TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {249324=© 2015, Cappex.com, LLC, 2891=Don't lose you I.D especially if you plan on using the bus. If you have eight o' clock classes I would recommend driving or catching 6:30 Wake Tech bus because any time after that buses will be crowded. Explore the campus and get used to walking especially if you have classes in two or more different buildings., 204595=Instructors are really good but the college claims they're having problems hiring instructors for evening courses. I'm enrolled in the pre-nursing program and have just 2 courses to go. One course in particular (Anatomy and Physiology II) has 3 offerings in the evening, but the lab is during the day -- what's the point!? And unfortunately, last semester this course was not offered at all during the evening. Wake Tech also changed the way students are allowed to register. It used to be first come first serve, but now, the more credits you have, the earlier you can register. So those just starting out at the college run the risk of not getting into the courses they need. That's what happened with the Microbiology course I needed. Just one course was offered on a Saturday, but there were students that had priority so the course was full even before it was open to students without that priority status. NC voters in 2012 approved a $200 Million bond for the college to expand and make repairs. Don't know why a college would spend money to expand when their halls are empty during the evening. I wish they would first offer more courses instead of expanding. I'm hoping most of my courses will transfer to another school. I really didn't want to attend a trade school, but it looks like that's what I may need to do.}

textAfterTable: Samuel from Apex, NC 02/07/2012 Reviewer is A current student here. 3 out of 3 people found this review useful. 3 of 59 Categories Comments Campus Safety very safe. there are a lot of security agents within the compound and the buildings are suited with safety gadgets for raising alarm if need be. emergencies are accorded utmost care and delicacy with which life-saving circumstances may require atleast for those that were handled in my presence. security is present even in parking lots. Clubs and Activities there are many clubs, both academic and co-curricular activities. its a wide range that you only get to make a choice depending on your interests Great for these types of students all students who have established the culture to learn and achieve both their academic and career goals through education, wake tech is the college for you. the school moulds you to a perfect fit into a full university( a four-year college) Share any unusual traditions or locations on campus
